title:
Characterizations of multidimensional compact almost automorphic
  functions and applications to Poissons and heat equations
authors: Alan Ch\'avez, Jolbyn Casta\~neda, Alexis R. Carranza, Kamal Khalil
abstract:
Let \(\mathcal{G}\) be a non-empty subset of the Euclidean space
\(\mathbb{R}^m\) (\(m \geq 1\)). This work is dedicated to further exploring
the properties of \(\mathcal{G}\)-multi-almost automorphic functions defined on
\(\mathbb{R}^m\) with values in a Banach space \(\mathbb{X}\). Using the theory
of \(\mathcal{G}\)-multi-almost automorphic functions, we provide two new
characterizations of compact almost automorphic functions. In the first
characterization, \(\mathcal{G}\) corresponds to the lattice subgroup
\(\mathbb{Z}^m \subset \mathbb{R}^m\); in the second, \(\mathcal{G}\) is taken
to be a dense subset of \(\mathbb{R}^m\). Furthermore, we establish the
invariance of the space of bounded and compactly \(\mathcal{G}\)-multi-almost
automorphic functions under integral operators with Bi-almost automorphic
kernels. Finally, we present applications to the analysis of the almost
automorphic dynamics of Poisson's equation and the heat equation.
